Plot!
Modern Warfare 3 starts off with the advantage of being a continuation of the ongoing Modern
Warfare plot, but then it fumbles the advantage and serves directly into the umpire's flaskete.
Once again the action switches back and forth between the US military fighting off the sinister
Russians and Captain Price et al in pursuit of some bastard who is apparently responsible.
I love how that always works, don't you?

Remember when they killed Osama Bin Laden and now there no terrorism anywhere in the world ever Occasionally you also play as other characters who always have the life expectancy of a rat That in a homeless man mouth but more on that later For to Modern Warfare because whatever the Strong Points of Battlefield
plot it was mostly ripped off from Call of Duty games so Modern Warfare basically gets
It's the prize either way.
Action!
It should be a given at this point that if you don't like endlessly pointing and clicking
at armoured brown blokes who are differentiated from the other armoured brown blokes you're
not supposed to shoot in ways that won't become clear until the third or fourth glance
or first round of bullets, then maybe you should go back to your pony riding simulators,
you little girl.
But there were many points in both games when I'd be in the middle of a war zone, unable
to see the baddies through the dust and smoke while my NPC allies all stole my kills, and
I'd reflect that shooters seemed to have lost their way.
Both games mix it up with vehicle sections, though.
Battlefield 3 lets you ride a tank into plane but spends the entire time flashing up big
arrows telling you when and where to press what buttons, but on the other hand it is
at least possible to fail if your head has recently caved in.
In Modern Warfare 3's vehicle sections you're usually just dropping conflagration on ground
targets from high above like you're God armed with a giant magnifying glass, so I
have to give this one to Battlefield for at least remembering that games need to in some
way challenge as well as satisfy your psychotic armchair genocide fantasies.
Let me just say that if realism is a make or break factor for you in a game about shooting
But what it worth Battlefield 3 is more realistic You die much easier under fire and sniper bullets even have drop
Wow.
Drop-off?
I love that, because it reminds me of my flaccid, impotent cock.
And even a terrorist group with three nukes and a seemingly bottomless supply of reinforcements
is more realistic than the Russian army somehow having the manpower to simultaneously invade
every capital city in Europe within days of pulling out of a full-scale invasion of the
United States.
Presumably while waiting for the order, large groups of Russian soldiers were all camped
outside each European city disguised as trees, so Battlefield 3 gets the point even though
Modern Warfare 3 is more fun because even if all your arms and legs have been shot off
you can still flop your way behind cover and suck on some nourishing gravel until it all
grows back.
Racism.
The ongoing plot of Modern Warfare involves the Russians basically being tricked into
war by that bastard Makarov making them think the Americans shot up that airport in Modern
Warfare 2.
And I assumed they set all that up so as to avoid painting Russians as inherently evil,
It must be said that the Russian populace really don't seem to have needed much persuading,
and their soldiers gun down unarmed civilians like free candy comes out of their brain holes.
The driving plot point of Modern Warfare 3 is tracking down the Russian President,
who was kidnapped on his way to working out a peace treaty with the West.
Now, if the Russian government was committed enough to peace that he was already on the plane,
puckering up for some imperialist bottom-kissing,
who the hell gave the order to invade Europe?
Because when the President finally does get into that meeting with the Western powers,
there are gonna be some fucking awkward items on the agenda,
full-scale chemical weapon attacks on civilians,

I think that a hard thing to blame on a few bad apples I think the problem might lie with the orchard Mr President You might want to stop watering it with liquidized children So yeah a point for Modern Warfare again because I could never quite tell what Battlefield 3 main villain accent was supposed to be
The shocking moment.
After nukes in MWU1 and fun with massacres in MWU2, we've come to expect a shocking moment in Modern Warfare games,
although since we are expecting it, it'd be more shocking if there wasn't one.
But sadly, no six-year-olds were around to explain this to the developers, and the shocking moment is hollow, token, and manipulative.
A child dies. Whoop-de-fucking-doo.
Children die all the time, especially if you tie them to the rear bumper of a car, it's not even difficult.
Meanwhile, Battlefield 3 nukes Paris. They don't dwell on it and it never comes up again.
They could at least have a bloke fly past the camera with a baguette stuck through his head.
Multiplayer! Puhuhuhuhuh, Ziff.
So after all that, who's the winner?
No one. Nobody is the winner.
The loser is the entire games industry and human society in general when the people who like these games
grow up, become president and call the Secretary of State for Defence a faggot for not wanting to nuke Switzerland.
But maybe it's not too late to save us if we start making games about nicer wars,
Like the Anglo-zanzibar war of 1896 that lasted 38 minutes.
You'd barely have time to shoot one British sailor before declaring peace and spending the rest of the afternoon beating them at cricket.
